results.title: New York: City of Cities
results.creator_credit: Peter May, Jerilyn Goodman, International Video Network and Producers Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
There’s no city on earth like New York. Start with the Statue of Liberty, welcoming beacon to millions of immigrants; continue on to Wall Street, seat of the stock exchange and quiet Trinity Church. Jostle through the garment district, gawk at the world’s tallest skyscrapers, and have a guided tour of NBC. Go inside the Metropolitan Museum to see the works of Van Gogh, Gauguin and Warhol, then continue on to the Guggenheim, Lincoln Centre, and Radio City Music Hall. Proceed to Broadway and Sardi’s Restaurant, with its walls of celebrity caricatures. Ride through Central Park in a horse-drawn carriage, then visit the United Nations. Enjoy the atmosphere of Chinatown, Greenwich Village, Little Italy, and Soho.

results.title: Talk 16
results.creator_credit: Adrienne Mitchell, Janis Lundman, Back Alley Film Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a most compelling and entertaining documentary about the personal lives of five young teenage girls aged between 15 and 16. Filmed over a one-year period, Janis Lundman and Adrienne Mitchell formed quite a remarkable bond with the girls, allowing the filmmakers to present an up-close and intimate insight into each of their lives. Meet Lina, Russian born, migrated to Canada with her family when she was 5 years old, inwardly rebellious and striving to be thought of as an adult by her family - her main aim in life is to find a boyfriend; Erin is from a middle-class family, attends private school, and wants to be a model but struggles with problems of body-image; Helen of Korean-born parents who are devout Christians and hold strict family values, is an honors student caught between two cultures; Astra, a runaway teenager, is an enigma - perceptive and articulate who considers herself a problem child, hates living by the rules and enjoys living on the edge, hanging out with druggies and ex-crims; Rhonda, brash, black and ambitious skips classes but will do anything to achieve her ambition to be an actress. From different socio-economic and cultural backgrounds, together these five young girls discuss sex, drugs, boyfriends, their future, feminism, beliefs and values, body image, and family with amazing frankness and humour. An interesting concept to see the changes in each of the girls over the year of filming. Voice and narration by Janis Lundman. (Award: Florida Film Festival 1994, Grand Jury Award)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Adrienne Mitchell, Janis Lundman, Back Alley Film Productions and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Great Cities of Europe
results.creator_credit: James R. Conner, Adler Enterprises, Calcon, International Video Network and Valentini
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Enjoy a grand tour of Europe’s most renowned cities: London, Dublin, Amsterdam, Munich, Vienna, Salzburg, Paris, Madrid, Athens and Rome. See romantic castles, picturesque canals, lively piazzas and splendid parks; meet the Europeans at work and play.

results.title: Taiwan; South Korea
results.creator_credit: David Rabinovitch, Richard Carey, Fumihiko Ninomiya, Leo Eaton, Film Australia and Nihon Hoso Kyokai
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini Dragons”.
Although Taiwan is in many ways an exemplary example of an Asian country which has boomed economically whilst diminishing the gap between the rich and the poor, it suffers from political power being held undemocratically by the ruling KMT party, a historical legacy, uncontrolled pollution and the influence of Japan. South Korea, on the other hand, has the largest gap between the rich and poor causing political unrest and violent protest, which along with increased competition from other rising economic powers in Asia may end South Korea’s era of economic success.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Rabinovitch, Richard Carey, Fumihiko Ninomiya, Leo Eaton, Film Australia and Nihon Hoso Kyokai

results.title: Germany: A Tapestry of Tradition
results.creator_credit: James R. Conner and Heumann-Reiss Production Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit West Germany, land of castles and kings, cathedrals and alpine peaks. Experience the quiet mystery of the Black Forest. Watch a craftsman carve a violin in the village of Mittenwald. Continue on to the awe-inspiring Gothic cathedrals of Wurzburg, Ettal and Nymphenburg. See the fairytale castle of Neuschwanstein, built by eccentric King Ludwig II, come alive. Then, join in the celebration of Munich’s Oktoberfest!

results.title: Tales of the city [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alan Poul, Antony Root, Alastair Reid, Channel 4, Propaganda and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: Since beginning as a serial,”Tales of the City”, in the San Francisco Chronicle, Armistead Maupin’s charming and very funny books about a group of people living in a block of flats in ‘70’s San Francisco has entertained people worldwide. This joint UK/USA production follows the story of Mary Ann Singleton, a young girl from the mid-west who moves into a flat owned by the wonderful Mrs Madrigal (Olympia Dukakis), a landlady who always has a willing shoulder to cry on and an endless supply of joints. Mary Ann becomes best friends with the handsome Mouse, a young man looking for Mr. Right. In this mad, exuberant world of disco, fast sex and good drugs, we follow the adventures of Mouse, Mary Ann and their fellow tenants as they fall in and out of love, party, and pick up strangers in laundromats. This excellent series is a glorious, comic tribute to a time when hedonism was innocent and when sex was safe. Co-starring Chloe Webb, Donald Moffat and Laura Linney. Screenplay by Richard Kramer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Poul, Antony Root, Alastair Reid, Channel 4, Propaganda and Working Title Films

results.title: Hong Kong ; Singapore
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Richard Carey, David Vasser, Film Australia and INCA
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini Dragons”.
The future of Hong Kong rests on what will happen in 1997 when it is returned to the rule of China. The program begins with an optimistic outlook, but after the Tienanmen Square massacre the pessimists begin to hold sway. Singapore enjoys a per capita income second only to Japan in Asia and gives an impression of racial harmony and excellent living conditions. However this success has been gained at the expense of many personal freedoms the rest of the world takes for granted, with the national propaganda machine hiding real inequities and threats from neighbouring and poorer Moslem countries.

results.title: Mini Dragons
results.creator_credit: Richard Carey, Film Australia, INCA and Nihon Hoso Kyokai
results.brief_description: A series which look at the new economic powers of the Asian region - Taiwan, South Korea, Hong Kong and Singapore. Through the eyes of disparate individuals from each country the programs look at the historical context of the mini dragons’ current success and the unique problems they face in their bid to retain economic leadership in the area.

results.title: Paris
results.creator_credit: Valerie Archer, International Video Network and Visa Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
A tourist’s guide to the main historical sites, hotels, shopping, nightlife and food of one of the world’s most loved cities - Paris. Includes a segment on the Palace of Versailles.
